positive_demos.question: What's the difference between Shia vs. Sunni Islam?
positive_demos.answer: The main difference between Shia and Sunni Muslim is related to ideological heritage and issues of leadership [1]. This difference is first formed after the death of the Prophet Muhammad in 632 A.D. [1][2]. The ideological practice of the Sunni branch strictly follows Prophet Muhammad and his teachings, while the Shia branch follows Prophet Muhammad's son-in-law Ali [2]. Nowadays, Sunni and Shia are the major branches of Islam [3].
